msContents.summary: The Saptavāra ("Seven Days") usually incorporates seven dhāraṇīs, the Vasudhārā, Vajravidāraṇā, Gaṇapatihṛdayā, Uṣṇīṣavijayā, Parṇaśavarī/Prajñāpāramitā, Mārīcī, and Grahamātṛkā. This collection associates each dhāraṇī with a specific day of the week, a tradition going back to at least the sixteenth century in Nepal. This fragmentary paper manuscript, probably to be ascribed to the 18th or 19th century, consists of the Vajravidāraṇā only, but its identification as an incomplete Saptavāra, although not certain, is suggested by the foliation.

msItem.title: Saptavāra
msItem.rubric: [4r1] oṃ namo bhagavate āryyava[space left blank for a miniature]javidāranyai, namo bu[4r2]ddhāya,
msItem.incipit: [4r2] evaṃ mayā śrutam e[space left blank for a miniature]kasmin_ samaye bhagavā[4r3]na, vajeṣu viharati sma [space left blank for a miniature] sarvaśalīlaṃ vajamaya[4r4]m adhiṣṭhāya vajapāṇi|¦[space left blank for a miniature]ś ca buddhānubhāvena sarva[4r5]buddhādhiṣṭhānāṃ rthmahā[space left blank for a miniature]krodhasaṃbhūtaṃ, vajasāra[4v1]padaṃ bhāṣate sma ||
msItem.explicit: [6v5] namaḥś caṃdraavajapāna[7r1]ya mahākrodhāya, huru 2 vaṃdha 2 hana 2 amṛte huṃ phaṭ_, hṛadayamaṃtraḥ namo ra[7r2]tnatrayāya, nama caṃdavajapāṇaya huru 2 tiṣṭha 2 vaṃdha 2 amṛte huṃ phaṭ_ svāhā ||

layout.p: 5 lines per page, approximately 30 akṣaras per line.
Triple marginal frame lines in black ink; ruling in red ink. Corrections with yellow paste.

list.item: On f. 4v, the akṣara ścaṃ, top left margin.
On f. 5v, the akṣara ā, top left margin.
On f. 6v, the akṣara svaṃ, top left margin.
